result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Tyrone Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample; pay costs and DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restiutution set at $0.
- No Contact with firearms. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, M.A. or G.A. UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment and/or school.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Tyrone Franklin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Tyrone Franklin in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Joshua Tyrone Franklin in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 30days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4-01-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, M.A. or G.A., UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment and/or school.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant Joshua Tyrone Franklin in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews JusticePoint report with the parties and advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.

Defendant Joshua Tyrone Franklin in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant has failed to keep any attorney appointments per defense counsel.  Defense counsel is now moving to withdraw as counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Court admonished defendant that he must cooperate with his counsel.  Attorney Dunn to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel will need to be appointed.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-1-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Kimberly A., or her residence, no contact with Kathleen A., or her residence, no firearms in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.    mld
